name: Are you NOCTURNAL? 2 Quiz | Wordplay for Kids | 10 Questions

questions.text: Using only the letters in NOCTURNAL, find a 4-letter word that means ripped.
questions.explanation:
Torn.

	Torn means that something is ripped, or that you have ripped something.  It can also mean that you are split between two decisions.  Sometimes, your heart can also be figuritively "torn" in two.

questions.text: Using only letters from NOCTURNAL, what is a 4-letter word meaning a lock of wavy and twisted hair?
questions.explanation:
Curl.

	Curls come in all shapes and sizes.  They can be very large curls, or they can be very small curls all over the head to create an afro!  Some dogs also "curl" their tail over their back.

questions.text: Find a 4-letter word meaning to be abrupt, using only the letters in NOCTURNAL.  It can also be someone's name.
questions.explanation:
Curt.

	To be curt means to be abrupt.  When you say that you've been curt with someone, you can also say you've been short with them.  It just means you were a bit rude to them...

questions.text: Using only letters found in NOCTURNAL, find a 3-letter word for a pesky rodent.
questions.explanation:
Rat.

	Rats are in the rodent family, so they are related to mice and beavers!  They are known to be very dirty, and even brought diseases of all kinds to America.  When they are raised in captivity and sold as pets, however, they are much cleaner, and can be very fun to have around.

questions.text: Find a word of 4 letters that means to take a journey led by a guide, using only letters from NOCTURNAL.
questions.explanation:
Tour.

	Tour guides will take you through wherever you are and show you sites.  If they are in a zoo, they will guide you through and show you the animals.  Tour guides usually talk about each thing they show you, like its history.

questions.text: Using only letters from NOCTURNAL, find a 4-letter word meaning a name for a person, place, thing, or emotion.
questions.explanation:
Noun.

	Nouns are anything that represent an object.  For instance, 'car' is a noun, and 'Barbara' is a noun.  They both represent things you can see.  Things like 'run' and 'breathe' are not nouns because they do not represent things you can see, but actions.  This means they are verbs.

questions.text: Using the letters from NOCTURNAL, find a 3-letter word meaning 'feline'.
questions.explanation:
Cat.

	Cats are very common house pets.  They love to cuddle (well, most of them, anyway), and are very loving, usually.  Cats love to sleep and lounge around for most of the day, and because they are partly nocturnal, they love to play at night.

questions.text: Find a 3-letter word, using only letters from NOCTURNAL, that might be a light shade of brown.
questions.explanation:
Tan.

	Tan is a light brown color.  Tan can also be what the sun gives you.  If you stay out in the sun for a period of time, you may get a tan, which darkens your skin.  But if you stay out too long, you may get burned, so be careful!

questions.text: Find a word that might describe Sister Mary Margaret, using only 3 letters from NOCTURNAL.
questions.explanation:
Nun.

	Nuns are called sisters.  They are women who are very religious, and belong to what is called a convent.  The set of clothes they wear is called a habit.

questions.text: This one is a little tricky.  What means to end or to cancel, using 5 letters from NOCTURNAL?
questions.explanation:
Annul.

	If something is annulled, it is no longer.  Annulment is the act of canceling or ending.
